intro: Monnina weberbaueri var. elongata, commonly known as the elongated bluemink, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological study.
